verses.text: 「到那一天（這是耶和華的宣告），敵人要把猶大列王、首領、祭司、先知和耶路撒冷居民的骸骨，都從他們的墳墓裡取出來，

words.note: Often refers to divine or official decrees in biblical context.
Refers to a succession or group of kings, common in historical biblical texts.
Literally 'one who knows beforehand'.
Specifically refers to the remains of a dead body.
A verb with directional complements.

verses.text: 拋散在太陽、月亮和天上的萬象之下，就是他們從前所愛慕、服事、跟隨、求問、敬拜的。這些骸骨必不再被收殮埋葬，必在地面上成為糞肥。

words.note: In biblical context, often refers to celestial bodies or the cosmos.
Indicates the following verb is the object of another action or nominalizes a verb phrase.
Stronger than simple love, implying deep admiration or longing.
Often used for serving a deity or master.
Often implies seeking guidance or a revelation from a divine source or authority.
Forms a relative clause modifying a noun, meaning 'that which (they worshipped)'.
Specifically refers to the remains of a dead body.
Refers to the process of preparing a body for burial.

verses.text: 這邪惡的家族剩下的餘民，在我驅逐他們到的各地，寧可選擇死，也不要存活。」這是萬軍之耶和華的宣告。

words.note: A key theological term referring to those who remain after judgment.
A divine title emphasizing God's sovereignty over celestial and earthly armies.
Often refers to divine or official decrees in biblical context.

verses.text: 「你要對他們說：『耶和華這樣說：人跌倒了，不再起來嗎？人偏離了，不再回轉嗎？

words.note: A verb with directional complements.
Often implies a moral or spiritual deviation from a correct path.
In religious contexts, often refers to repentance or turning back to God.

verses.heading: Willful Disregard of God Will Lead to Destruction

verses.text: 這人民為甚麼背道，耶路撒冷為甚麼長久偏離？他們定意行詭詐，不肯回轉。

words.note: Refers to abandoning religious faith or moral principles.
Often implies a moral or spiritual deviation from a correct path.
To firmly set one's intention or purpose.
Refers to engaging in deceptive or treacherous behavior.
In religious contexts, often refers to repentance or turning back to God.

verses.text: 我留心聽，但他們都不說真實的話。沒有人為自己的惡行後悔，說：「我究竟作了甚麼？」他們各人繼續走自己偏差的路，像戰馬直衝入戰場。
連空中的鸛鳥也知道自己來去的季候；斑鳩、燕子和白鶴也謹守遷移的時令；我的子民卻不曉得耶和華的法則。

words.note: Refers to God's chosen people.

verses.text: 你們怎可以說：「我們是智慧人，我們有耶和華的律法」呢？事實上，經學家虛假的筆已把律法變成謊言了。

words.note: Refers to people with wisdom, often divine.

verses.text: 智慧人必蒙羞，驚惶失措。看哪！他們棄絕了耶和華的話，他們還有甚麼智慧呢？

words.note: An idiom meaning to be in a state of extreme panic and confusion.

verses.text: 因此，我必把他們的妻子給別人，把他們的田地給別的主人，因為他們從最小的到最大的，個個都貪圖不義之財；從先知到祭司，全都行事詭詐。

words.note: Lit. 'unrighteous wealth'.

verses.text: 他們草率地醫治我子民（「我子民」原文作「我子民的女子」）的損傷，說：「平安了！平安了！」其實沒有平安。』

words.note: Describes actions done without proper care or thought.
Forms adverbs from adjectives (e.g., 'quickly')
The original text note indicates 'the daughter of my people'.

verses.text: 耶和華說：『他們行了可憎的事，本應覺得羞愧，可是他們一點羞愧都沒有，恬不知恥。因此他們必仆倒在倒下的人中間；我懲罰他們的時候，他們必倒下來。

words.note: An idiom meaning 'to be without any sense of shame'.
Directional complement indicating movement downwards and towards the speaker.

verses.text: 我要徹底除掉他們的莊稼；葡萄樹上必沒有葡萄，無花果樹上必沒有無花果，葉子也必枯乾。我賜給他們的，都離開他們過去了。』」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Lit. 'flowerless fruit tree', as fig flowers are internal.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun clause: 'that which I gave to them'.

verses.text: 我們為甚麼坐著不動呢？你們要集合起來，我們要進入堅固的城裡去，在那裡滅亡吧！因為耶和華我們的 神要我們滅亡，又把毒水給我們喝，因我們得罪了耶和華。

words.note: Adds a softer, inquiring tone to a question.
Indicates upward movement or the start/completion of an action.
Adds a sense of suggestion, command, or agreement.
Used as a proper noun referring to the Judeo-Christian God.
Used in 'ba' sentence structure for emphasis or disposal.
Lit. 'to incur guilt/sin'.

verses.heading: Jeremiah Laments over the Coming Destruction

verses.text: 我們期待平安，卻得不到好處；期待得醫治的時候，不料，只有驚慌。

words.note: Expresses a turn or contrast; 'however, on the contrary'.
A common structure 'V+bu+D.C.' meaning 'cannot accomplish V'.

verses.text: 從但那裡聽見敵人戰馬的噴氣聲，全地因聽見壯馬的嘶鳴聲震動。他們來是要吞滅土地和地上所有的，要吞滅城和城中的居民。

words.note: Lit. 'spray-air sound'.
Lit. 'hiss-cry sound'.

verses.text: 「看哪！我要打發毒蛇到你們中間，是沒有法術能制伏的，牠們必咬你們。」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: An interjection used to draw attention, common in biblical texts.
More formal or archaic than '送' for 'send'.

verses.text: 我的愁苦無法醫治（按照《馬索拉抄本》，本句意思難確定；現參照《七十士譯本》翻譯），我的心在我裡面悲痛欲絕。

words.note: An idiom describing extreme grief.

verses.text: 聽啊！我同胞（「同胞」原文作「人民的女子」）的呼救聲，從遙遠之地傳來：「耶和華不在錫安嗎？錫安的王不在其中嗎？」「他們為甚麼以自己雕刻的偶像，和列國虛無的偶像，來惹我發怒呢？」

words.note: An exclamation to draw attention, like 'Hark!' or 'Hear ye!'
In biblical context, 'daughters' (of Zion) or 'women'.
之 (zhī) is an archaic possessive particle, similar to '的'.

verses.text: 「收割期已過，夏天也結束；但我們仍未獲救。」
因著我的同胞（「同胞」原文作「人民的女子」）被壓碎，我的心破碎了；我悲傷痛哭，驚慌抓住了我。

words.note: Indicates cause or reason.
Lit. 'from the same womb', emphasizing shared origin.
In biblical context, often 'daughters of'.

verses.text: 難道基列沒有乳香嗎？難道那裡沒有醫生嗎？我的同胞（「同胞」原文作「人民的女子」）為甚麼總不痊愈呢？

words.note: Used to express surprise, doubt, or rhetorical question.
A fragrant resin, used for medicine and incense, often translated as 'balm of Gilead'.
In biblical context, often 'daughters of'.
Adds a softer or rhetorical tone to a question.
